events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on March 30, resulting in significant front-end damage to their car.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under 'Auto Accident' due to references of car collision and damage.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the investigation and processing of the customer’s vehicle accident claim.
Customer was contacted to acknowledge receipt of the auto accident claim and informed about the next steps.
Customer was asked to provide police report, vehicle damage photos, and repair estimates to proceed with claim processing.
Customer uploaded requested evidence including accident report, detailed damage photos, and mechanic's repair quote.
Assigned agent began reviewing submitted documents and coordinating with third-party assessors for vehicle inspection.
Investigation concluded confirming the accident circumstances and validating the extent of vehicle damage claimed.
A settlement offer was prepared including total estimated repair costs and compensation for temporary transport.
Customer responded with acceptance of the settlement offer and appreciation for clear communication throughout the process.
The claim was formally approved authorizing the disbursement of funds to cover vehicle repairs and associated costs.
Payment was processed and sent directly to the customer’s designated bank account for the insured vehicle repairs.
The claim file was closed after confirmation that repairs were completed satisfactorily and no further action needed.
All documentation and correspondence were archived in the system per compliance regulations for future reference.
